intro: Bulbostylis parvinux, commonly known as the small-leaf bulbostylis, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically important species in its native range.
